I don t know there is something about having a tangible game for me I grew up with cartridges though so I m sure it s different for millennials there was nothing like hearing the sound of plastic knocking together looking for your favorite game back in the day Mega Man 2 for sure I stopped really gaming during college Besides having Wii because my roommates and I had girlfriends that were surprisingly down to play while drinking and doing yay lol My roommates after college had a PS3 so I played a few games on that and bought a few for the house like Resident Evil 5 6 MvC3 Ultimate and Modern Warefares 1 3 But ya by the time the PS4 came out I was 30 so definitely didn t really have a desire to play it What s funny is I worked at Best Buy as a manager still at the time All I knew about the new consoles was that people were crazy about them that holiday haha didn t play one til 2019 My friend sold me one recently for only 50 cause he was moving so I picked up basically sequels to all the games I grew up on like MKXL Resident Evil 7 Kingdom Hearts 3 RE 2 3 remakes and Until Dawn which I had always seen videos on and intrigued me and I have no regrets it s f n awesome
